annotation.TEXT: Well, that anger phase consisted of just a single 3-way shot, which you're safe from in the lower-right corner. But now, he's gonna launch shots at multiple different angles, and there is no safe spot this time.
Whoops. Blue switch is up here, dood.
I guess I'll also chug the health potion while I'm here, for no reason in particular.
Oh, no! AHH!!!
Yeah, this gem is a stumper if you don't know about that secret passage. Anyway, let's finish the level now.
Well, I just ran out of mana over those spikes. At least I didn't die, but I missed a slime that I intended to include in that combo.
To be continued... Yo!
Anyway, while you're in here to get the gem, also be sure to hit this 1 switch once, to set something up for later.
Next, step on this purple switch and move the ball to the right so that it shoves the gravblock onto the scale platform, which will raise the other scale platform and let you through.
Gotta wait for the timer to reach 190...
Wait, what? Mira's shots can hit that one? Is it just a tiny iota closer to the glass than the one above?
This'll place the upper gravblock on top of the other one, and now when the green gate switch is pressed, the gem won't be blocked.
Alright! Man, I really had to stretch to make that combo work.
Alright, that makes 37, so now I just gotta grab the gem then hit the goal while the ones digit of my timer is a zero.
Or, maybe I can only hit them during a particular part of their shooting animation.
So, you can stand there and just blast him. And, if you aim high enough, you shouldn't budge from your spot on the floor. Once you've knocked off 20% of his life, he'll enter his first anger phase.
Oh, well. So, go through the down-arrow field while avoiding the > shots...
Master combo! (7 kills, 14,000 points)
KA-BOOM!!! +9000 points and +1 star, like usual. However, I think the next boss will be when they start being worth at least 2 stars.

Oh, man. He's double-barreled now. Aside from that, he follows the same pattern as the previous regular phase. 3 low shots, then 4 more rapid high shots. Get on the floor before the high shots get to you.
3-3 didn't unlock any new levels, as expected. Now, 3-BOSS came in second place in the votes, so guess where I'm gonna go with Mira now!
Blaster combo! (9 kills, 22,500 points)
And now for his final phase, his two guns will fire at different angles. Fortunately, there's no rapid fire, but it's still more to pay attention to than usual.
Watch out for the spikes in this shaft, and then get ready to splatter more slimes!
I'm not sure... Well, I'm not gonna waste too much time figuring that out. Anyway, let's fly up here, kill the one unsheltered shooter, then fall into the boss room.
BTW, if you guys were truly observant, you might've spotted something of interest near the blue switch, but I'll get to that later. For now, let's get the gem down here.
Place your votes for either 3-5 (Overfall), 3-6 (Deadfall), 4-1 (Wide Sky), or 4-2 (Unguided Tour)!
Unfortunately for Pannenkoek, there's no way to get this gem with zero A button presses. Not even Scuttlebug raising or parallel universes will help with this one.
So, just like before, these purple switches involve the mouse wheel. Only this time, the mouse wheel moves that purple ball, which I can make roll either left or right.
Just like with anger phase #2, he fires a 3-way shot, then a 4-way shot. But then he'll fire another 3-way, followed by another 4-way. So, you just have to dodge twice instead of once.
Don't mind my little adjustment of the scale lifts right there.
Alright, now let's take a look at the final gem's setup...
Now, this timer switch only lasts for 8 seconds, so you gotta hustle a bit to reach the upper room in time. However, you also have to watch out for the spikes on the way there.
Oh, and I've unlocked the Time Attack for world 3.
I thought about dealing with that purple tilting gate there now, but that can also wait for later.

So, yep! That's why I parked the ball in the corner above the A button, then manually adjusted the scale lifts, so that the ball could later roll through that secret passage and onto the blue switch for me!
Hello, and welcome back to Miracle Fly! Now, before I get to the voting results, I'm just gonna point out one thing here.
Nope, I'm still good.
He fires 3 low shots, then 4 higher shots at a faster rate, which will be difficult to dodge if you're still in the air. Anyway, at 60% damage, he'll enter his third anger phase.

Okay, so he starts off by shooting at two different alternating low angles. You're completely safe up in the air. And in addition, there's a safe spot on the ground in between his two shots' trajectories!
I just figured I'd mention that, since someone requested that I do a Time Attack of 1-BOSS. Anyway, now for the voting results...
Oh, man! Go up high to dodge the first barrage, then get down to the floor and close to him to dodge the second. For the third barrage, you gotta dodge through the middle.
Maneuver these green blocks to shove the purple ball down below, and make sure to move the horizontal green block back to the right so that it's not blocking the gem.
Nah, it'll have to do with balance lifts, eventually. So, first, let's splatter the three slimes in the starting area, then check out a new object.
Super combo! (4 kills, 5000 points)
I'm not worried about that one hit I took. This boss isn't ridiculously difficult, and there'll be a health potion in the room.
Alright, it's boss time! (Conveniently, the health potion doesn't appear until after you've fallen past it, so you won't accidentally collect it on entry.)
Uh, oh. Is that purple ball gonna be in my way?
The correct answer is... roll the ball left. You can get past this part by rolling the ball either way, but you need the ball on the left if you want that gem.
Obviously, the first thing to do is press the blue switch with the ball in order to get that gem.
There will still be periods of time when you can attack him safely from a place he's not firing at for a few seconds, so take advantage of that.
Then, roll it on over to the yellow switch in order to proceed with the level.
And, at 80% damage, he'll enter his final anger phase. It'll start off with the same 3-way and 4-way shots, but then he'll add in a few barrages after that.
Now, to begin with, let's splatter some slimes as usual, before looking at any part of this contraption.

Okay, now for the third regular phase, he does low-to-high angled shots again, but he fires the higher ones at a more rapid rate. Definitely try to get down to the floor after the first few low shots.
Now, watch out for the spikes here. Oh, man... Will I have enough oomph to include all these slimes in this combo?
Daria, your turn!

Well, looking at the setup here, I'll need something to weigh down that A switch in order to reach the gem in the upper-left, and there's a timer gate holding up a gravity block that'll fall onto the right scale lift, so...
Of course, now the blue gate is in the way, but that's easy to fix. Also, I'm going to go around now and collect enough enemy coins to reach 37 so I can get the 3-star bonus.
Wow, I wonder how my laser went through that one slime without hitting him a few times. Well, whatever. Now let's take a look at this contraption...
So, are we experimenting with fish scales or musical scales?

Ah, but that purple switch controlled something else besides the purple gate! And, if you were observant earlier, you might've noticed a black line in the ceiling above the blue switch, indicating a secret passage!

Anyway, the 1 switch also moved this 1 block, which was previously in a spot that would've prevented the purple ball from getting to the A button. And, you probably saw the blue switch behind an A gate below.
C-C-C-C-Combo breaker! (7 kills, 14,000 points)
Alright, now there were a couple of gems down there behind blue gates. I'll be getting to those later. For now, let's go back up for the first gem.
Oh, and I do believe that I can get the 3-star bonus again, by leaving just one of these coins behind.
♦ush!
Hitting that blue switch unlocks the timer switch room, and I'll hit the timer switch in a moment, but I want to kill slimes first.
Uh, oh. Did my combo break?
And, there we go. Now, I'll just leave the ball snug up against the corner there, and go hit the blue switch.
Okay, so there's this scale platform in the way, and I can hit the green gate switch there to drop the gravblocks onto it. That alone would be good enough for me to reach the exit.
As usual, I'll leave most enemy coins alone for the time being. However, I collected the coins the first three slimes dropped, because I think I'll end up locking that yellow gate later.
In this anger phase, he'll fire the same 3-way shot again, followed by a 4-way shot that you will need to make a move to dodge.
Okay, that unlocked 4-1. Now, let's do one more level, and 3-A came in third in the votes, so let's play 3-A!
Triple combo! (3 kills, 3000 points)
Well, first, let's clear out these cracked blocks so that I can rotate the purple gate out of my way...
...Oh... My combo will have to end here. Okay, so there's a purple ball and these scale platforms. Obviously, I need to roll the ball onto one of the platforms, but which one is best?

Now, here's the stumper. I need to hit the yellow switch in order to proceed to the last part of the level, but the gem there is also blocked by a blue gate, and there's no gate switches over there. Whatever shall I do?

Huh. Surprisingly, no. The game let me move the ball myself ever so slightly so that I could get through, even though I normally cannot shove the ball myself. Maybe it was due to me being up against a wall there.
Boss levels don't have Time Attacks for them. You can only Time Attack regular levels.
Alright, clearing 3-A unlocks 4-2, so this could've been a way for me to get into world 4 without fighting the world 3 boss, but that's kind of a moot point now.
Whoa, I almost hit the green gate switch by accident there. If I had, I would've ended up wasting about 10 more seconds of the viewers' time going back to hit the blue gate switch again.

Now, we'll need the purple ball down here, and... Oh, bugger. I've gone and blocked off that purple switch with that 1 wall. Fortunately, there's another purple switch below that also controls this ball, even if it's off-screen.

Alright, let's go get gem #2. First, I'll step on the timer switch to drop the gravblock onto the right scale lift below, which will raise the left scale lift with the purple ball upwards. Then, just roll the ball to the left onto the A button.
Of the five valid levels to pick from here, there were 0 votes for 3-5, 0 votes for 3-6, 1 vote for 3-A, 3 votes for 3-BOSS, and 6 votes for 3-3!
There's a mana star here, which could be helpful. Also, a health potion, in case you got spiked or slimed a bit on the way here.
So, 3-3 is where I'll be starting today! Irvette, you're up!
Also, watch out for the slime on the left as you enter. Now, once inside, splatter the two slimes, then hit the light green switch here and drag the light green block to the right.
Brutal combo! (6 kills, 10,500 points)
Huh. Oddly, the scale platform on the right bounced up higher than you'd expect it to normally go for a second there. Anyway, let's splatter some more slimes.

So, guide this ball down onto the left scale lift, then when it drops down, move it to the right, off of the lift. When the right scale lift drops back down, have the ball shove the gravblock there onto the A button.
And, done!
As expected, there are shooter enemies here. Unfortunately, the first two are behind glass, and they're just a little too far back for Mira's shots to hit them.
And now, let's splatter some more slimes!

He fires at six different angles going from low to high this time. After the first couple, get down in front of him and blast him some more while he's aiming high. At 40% damage, he'll get angry again.
But, the gravblocks will block the gem unless I do something else first, and that something involves the room with the two slimes above, so let's head back to that timer switch...
Anyway, you guys have four different levels that you can vote for now.
